articles.author: ALBERT AJI
articles.description: DAMASCUS, Syria (AP) — Israel carried out at least two airstrikes on a western neighborhood of Damascus and one of the capital’s suburbs on Thursday, killing at least 15 people and wounding another 16, Syria's state news agency said.
articles.title: 2 Israeli airstrikes hit Syria's capital and a suburb, killing 15 people, Syrian state media say

articles.author: DEE-ANN DURBIN
articles.description: Americans are fed up with the price of food, and many are looking to President-elect Donald Trump to lower their grocery bills.
articles.title: Food prices worried most voters, but Trump's plans likely won't lower their grocery bills

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES and LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republicans have won enough seats to control the U.S. House, completing the party’s sweep into power and securing their hold on U.S. government alongside President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: Republicans win 218 US House seats, giving Donald Trump and the party control of government

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump has had few defenders in Congress as reliable as Matt Gaetz, who has thundered at one prosecutor after another for perceived bias against the president-elect and emphatically amplified the Republican's rallying cry that the criminal investigations into him are “witch hunts.”
articles.title: Gaetz pick shows value Trump places on loyalty — and retribution — as he returns to Washington

articles.author: DAVE COLLINS
articles.description: The satirical news publication The Onion won the bidding for Alex Jones' Infowars at a bankruptcy auction, backed by families of Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims whom Jones owes more than $1 billion in defamation judgments for calling the massacre a hoax.
articles.title: Satire publication The Onion buys Alex Jones' Infowars at auction with Sandy Hook families' backing

articles.author: ANITA SNOW and CEDAR ATTANASIO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Maribel Hidalgo fled her native Venezuela a year ago with a 1-year-old son, trudging for days through Panama's Darien Gap, then riding the rails across Mexico to the United States.
articles.title: 1 million migrants in the US rely on temporary protections that Trump could target

articles.author: MOGOMOTSI MAGOME
articles.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — South Africa's government says it will not help an estimated 4,000 illegal miners inside a closed mine in the country's North West province who have been denied access to basic supplies as part of an official strategy against illegal mining.
articles.title: South African government says it won't help thousands of illegal miners inside a closed mine

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Ford Motor Co. will pay a penalty of up to $165 million to the U.S. government for moving too slowly on a recall and failing to give accurate recall information.The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration says in a statement Thursday that the civil penalty is the second-largest in its 54-year history.
articles.title: Ford agrees to pay up to $165 million penalty to US government for moving too slowly on recall

articles.author: MARK KENNEDY and DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Veteran NBC host and news anchor Craig Melvin has been tapped to replace Hoda Kotb as co-host of the 7 a.m.
articles.title: Veteran NBC host Craig Melvin tapped to replace Hoda Kotb for the first hours of 'Today' show

articles.author: MATTHEW PERRONE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Those ever-present TV drug ads showing patients hiking, biking or enjoying a day at the beach could soon have a different look: New rules require drugmakers to be clearer and more direct when explaining their medications' risks and side effects.
articles.title: New FDA rules for TV drug ads: Simpler language and no distractions
